message:
Hi stepen amazing article we are facing a strange problem. Can you please provide your thought.

Our client B is connected to TCP server A.

Also to note B is communicating with a service C over IPC.

So traditionally request from A would be passed to B(over TCP) and than to C (Over IpC).

And the response is from C-B (over IPC) and B to A over TCP.

Now here the problem we are facing(problem since it happen randomly)

We see all request from A logged in our log. Like wise response that is about to sent to A (received by B from C) from B is being and logged as well(which exist in our log).

Now there are time when we are being informed that A is not getting response.

We then confirm this with ngrep.

Now the thing is if we restart C we see the message getting sent to A from B  
Not sure what is the reason for this.

Same happen if we restart B . We see the old messages (those were stuck) getting passed.not sure how that happened too.

During all this time B receive message from A and response from C.

Its so annoying we are not able to track it and solve it from past 2 week.
